p: A quantity of 0.25 g of sample (dry ethanolic extract, dry aqueous extract, and powdered raw material) was dissolved in 5 mL of methanol. The working reagent was prepared by mixing acetate buffer (300 mM, pH 3.6), a solution of 10 mM TPTZ (2,4,6-tris(2-pyridyl)- s-triazine) in 40 mM HCl, and 20 mM FeCl 3·6H 2O at a ( v/ v/ v) ratio of 10:1:1. A total of 100 μL of each properly diluted extract solution was prepared in tubes with 3 mL of working reagent and shaken for 30 s. After 2 h of incubation, the absorbance was read at 593 nm. A series of Trolox and Fe 2SO 4 solutions in the concentration ranges of 0–479 μg/mL and 0–1000 μg/mL, respectively, was used to prepare the calibration curve. The results were expressed as Trolox equivalents of antioxidant capacity in μmol Trolox per gram of extract, and Fe 2+ antioxidant capacity (Fe 2+ μmol/g of extract) [ 47, 48].
